forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 54. South southwest wind 7 to 12 mph, with gusts as high as 18 mph. Chance of precipitation is 40%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Thursday
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain. Partly sunny. High near 61, with temperatures falling to around 59 in the afternoon. South southwest wind 8 to 15 mph, with gusts as high as 22 mph. Chance of precipitation is 50%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As the clock inches past midnight in Downtown San Francisco, a gentle moisture hangs in the air, hinting at the probability of rain as foretold. The low beckons at a cool 54 degrees under a mostly cloudy sky, softened by a faint whisper of winds from the south. Such breezes, playful yet charged with potential, could render the chill a tad more biting, making the warmth of a light jacket or sweater a prudent companion for those stepping outside tonight.

As the day awakens, a promise of intermittent rays weaves through the clouds, accompanying the chance of rain that carries into Thursday. Temperature highs flirt with the 60-degree mark, however, a slight retreat into the afternoon shadows beckons comfort and adaptability. With winds enhancing that coastal bite, layered attire will prove fruitful — perhaps a light scarf paired with a reliable umbrella for when the skies decide to weep. The city, draped in this shifting light and semi-clarity, calls for a stroll along its storied streets or a leisurely visit to a local café, where you can sip on a warm brew while observing the gentle dance of raindrops.

Given the brisk ambiance and tentative sunlight, the day is best appreciated at a sublime pace, taking full advantage of the city's urban charm while flitting in and out of warm havens. Rediscover the art of casual exploration; perhaps meander through the twisting alleyways of Chinatown or find a quiet nook in one of the many parks, all while keeping an eye on the weather’s mood — an embrace of all things San Francisco.
